course.subject: LANG
course.name: Chinese for Non-Chinese Language Background Students IV
course.description: This course builds on the groundwork laid in LANG 1120, LANG 1121 and LANG 1122, and takes students to an intermediate level of understanding of spoken Chinese and a stronger communicative competence in using Chinese in social, professional and business situations.  The course is restricted to students with non-Chinese language backgrounds. Instructors’ approval is required for students with Chinese backgrounds who are from international schools of Hong Kong, China Mainland and other Asian countries, also for overseas students with either Mandarin or Cantonese language backgrounds. For students without prerequisite but with prior Chinese learning experience of approximately 150 hours may seek instructors’ approval to enroll in the course.
course.exclusions: HKDSE/HKALE/HKCEE/JEE Chinese, LANG 1113, LANG 1114 (prior to 2017-18), LANG 1115 (prior to 2017-18), LANG 1116 (prior to 2017-18), LANG 1117, LANG 1118

reviews.author: 0607a
reviews.title: It was a normal course
reviews.comment_content:
Useful content suitable to the level. The topics are mainly focused on University life
1. Settle down on campus (starting the semester and living on campus)
2. Living on campus (describing living situations, environments, furniture, roommate, pros and cons)
3. Major and Job (what you want to study in University and what you want to become when you grow up)
4. Outing and Planning (where you went on the weekend or your travelling experiences)

If you did IB Chinese then this should be quite simple for you
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is good and she makes sure all students try to understand properly. She will pick on you randomly so be prepared for that. She will repeat the instructions in English if you don't understand.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading and you have to make sure that you attend majority of the classes. You cannot miss more than five classes or else you fail but I suggest you attend all. Make sure you participate in class
reviews.comment_workload: Workload was not too heavy but make sure you do the readings before class and most work is done in class when you participate. You have to write a few essays but it is not too difficult and the professor will give you a lot of feedback on how you can improve in your writing.

reviews.author: vrcvictor
reviews.comment_content: Covers HSK Level 3 content. Topics in this course cover living on campus, majors, jobs, and traveling.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very clear teaching. Open to answer questions. The instructor teaches additional vocabulary that is also useful in everyday life.
reviews.comment_grading:
4 writing assignments (2.5% each)

First half of the course:
Writing Assessment 1 (5%) (Essay Writing)
Oral Presentation 1 (20%)
Written test 1 (20%) (Dictionary allowed) (Listening, reading, writing)

Second half:
Writing Assessment 2 (5%) (Essay Writing)
Oral Presentation 2 (20%)
Written test 2 (20%) (Dictionary not allowed) (Listening, reading, writing)

Absolute Graded.
Attendance is also taken.
reviews.comment_workload: Relatively light workload. HW includes 4 writing assignments and can be useful for the oral presentations and written tests.

reviews.author: McBoy
reviews.title: good chinese course
reviews.comment_content: HSK 3 level for reading and writing, Over HSK level 3 for speaking and listening. Topics cover about travelling around Hong Kong, Living in Hong Kong, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Clear teaching, and the lessons taught are applicable on daily lives. It is one of the courses I never skip a class. Great language teacher.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade if you are diligent. Try your best on the oral presentations, it's rewarded very well, unlike in some language courses.
reviews.comment_workload: Easy workload, most of the workload is related to the tests. Just do the assignments and you will get full marks.

reviews.author: Gracia
reviews.comment_content:
Topics:
Living in Hong Kong , Renting apartment, Living on vs off-campus, Leisure activities, Travelling , Choosing major , Life goal and expectation.

The course does not requires students to memorize all the new vocabulary and grammar.On the other hand, students need remember some phrase which are often used in the dialogue in the book.
reviews.comment_teaching: She encourage students to ask questions. In addition,she gives additional vocabulary related to daily life.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading.

Assignment (4 x 2.5%)
Assessment One (MIDTERM)
I. Oral presentation (points: 20%)
Topic: Renting an apartment ( 2 students in a group)
II. Written assessment (points: 25%)

Assessment Two(FINAL)
I. Oral presentation (20%)
Topic:Personal Statement
II. Written assessment (points: 25%)
reviews.comment_workload:
4 homework ,graded based on completion.
These homework also help for speaking assessment.
You can display some pictures and words in PPT during speaking test.
Dictionary is allowed for a part of writing assessment.

reviews.author: Umer
reviews.title: LANG 1123 COURSE REVIEW
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly about HSK Level 3 content (links to it are given on canvas upon registration). Topics in this course cover living on campus, majors in University, applying for jobs and also traveling around the world.

Relatively easy topics which allow students to learn how to adapt to the Hong Kong environment, rent places and apply for jobs locally.
reviews.comment_teaching: Personally speaking, Professor Nuo, Min is very friendly and helpful towards her students. She will send out emails to check up on her students and see their progress in their works. Constant feedbacks are also given back to assignments and presentations to improve students for finals. She also provides students with multiple resources and materials to work on by themselves. She also divided students into groups to do a project (ungraded) to practice for the speaking task.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading for this course is rather straight forward.
It is absolute grading. >85% A range, >70% B range, >55% C range, etc.
Attendance is compulsory!!! You may miss up to 5 classes throughout the whole semester only.

My scores:
Oral 1 (20%): 17.5%
Written 1 (25%): 20.5%
Oral 2 (20%): 18%
Written 2 (25%): 24%
Assignments (x4 @2.5%each): 10%
Total (100%): 90%
Letter grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Relatively light workload. HW includes 4 writing assignments each of 2.5% weighting. Although easy to finish the work, it might get lengthy for certain students as writing requirements for attaining A range is >1000 words essays x2. The essays can be useful for oral presentations and written tests, and I recommend people taking it in the future to put work into those assignments as the teacher will mark them and give you feedback to improve them for your presentations.

The first essay was about renting an apartment in Hong Kong.
The second essay was about writing your personal statement to apply for jobs.
